alert.note: Alert for Central St. Louis; South Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 5:48PM CST until February 23 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 9 inches. * WHERE...Central St. Louis and South Itasca Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Bois Forte Band, Lake Vermilion area. * WHEN...Until midnight CST Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This will be a prolonged period of snow with two main waves. The first is moving through this evening with a break in snow intensity tonight. The second will occur on Tuesday with the snow diminishing in intensity Tuesday night. The snow should be dry and fluffy. Gusty winds will cause some blowing and drifting as well.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
